mixed-citation.named-content: Zelotes hyrcanus Zamani & Chatzaki & Esyunin & Marusik 2021, sp. nov.
mixed-citation.article-title: One new genus and nineteen new species of ground spiders (Araneae: Gnaphosidae) from Iran, with other taxonomic considerations

tp:treatment-sec.p: The new species is similar to Z. eugeni Kovblyuk, 2009 and Z. longipes (L. Koch, 1866) by having a similarly shaped atrium and anterior hood. It differs from Z. eugeni by having anterior hoods that are 1.3 times as wide as the atrium (vs almost 2 times). It differs from Z. longipes by the longer lateral margins, ⅔ as long as atrium (vs ½) and the diverging copulatory ducts adjoining to receptacles (vs parallel).
The specific epithet is an adjective and refers to Hyrcanian region, in which the type locality of the new species is located.

p.tp:material-citation: Holotype IRAN • ♀ ; Mazandaran Province , 20 km north of Chalus ; May 2015 ; D. Kasatkin leg.; MHNG .

tp:treatment-sec.p: Habitus as in Fig. 27D . Total length 9.33. Carapace 3.01 long, 2.10 wide. Eye sizes and interdistance of PMEs: AME = 0.08, ALE = 0.10, PME = 0.11, PLE = 0.10, PME–PME = 0.06. Carapace, chelicerae, maxillae, labium and sternum black. Chelicerae ( Fig. 27E ) with 4 pro- and 1 or 2 retromarginal teeth. Legs the same color as carapace and without annulations. Abdomen dark gray, without any patterns. Spinnerets slightly darker than abdomen, uniform in color. Measurements of legs: I: 6.72 (1.98, 1.29, 1.33, 1.14, 0.98), II: 5.85 (1.52, 1.14, 1.13, 1.06, 1.00), III: 5.45 (1.48, 0.80, 0.97, 1.30, 0.90), IV: 8.23 (1.89, 1.33, 1.64, 2.16, 1.21).

Epigyne as in Fig. 27A–C . Epigynal plate slightly longer than wide; atrium large, rounded posteriorly and with parallel margins anteriorly; lateral margins ⅔ of atrium’s length; anterior part of margins with small hoods, anterior hoods distinct, separated by 0.77 of epigyne length (from posterior margin to anterior hoods); receptacles round, touching each other, diameter almost 4 times smaller than atrium width; copulatory ducts diverging.
Known only from the type locality in Mazandaran Province , northern Iran .
